channel.title: Odd sayings
channel.description:
"You wanna flush the toilet? Do it yourself, I'm not gonna lend you a toilet flusher."
What does that mean o.o?

item.title: Odd sayings
item.dc:creator: @Pblord7 Pblord7
item.description:
@Pblord7 wrote:

[quote=“EmulousGuru, post:10, topic:365406”][quote]
Definitions of poop on the Web:

* crap: obscene terms for feces
* nincompoop: a stupid foolish person
* dope: slang terms for inside information; "is that the straight dope?"
* stern: the rear part of a ship
  wordnetweb.princeton.edu/perl/webwn

* Puppis is a constellation in the southern sky. Its name is the Latin word for the poop deck of a ship, and Puppis represents the deck of the ship and its deckhouses. ...
  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poop_(constellation)

* The stern of a ship; To break seawater the poop of a vessel, especially the poop deck; To ship over the stern
  en.wiktionary.org/wiki/poop

* Pooping - Defecation is the final act of digestion by which organisms eliminate solid, semisolid or liquid waste material (feces) from the digestive tract via the anus. ...
  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pooping

* pooped - Tired; exhausted; To be pooped, in nautical parlance, means to have a wave come over the stern from abaft
  en.wiktionary.org/wiki/pooped

* The raised part of a vessel at her extreme after end. To be pooped is when running before the wind a sea breaks in over the stern.
  www.thecheappages.com/kemp/dictPQ.html

* An extra deck on the after part of a vessel. PORT.—The left-hand side of the ship OS you stand looking forward. PRIZE.—In war time, any vessel taken at sea from an enemy. PROTECTIVE DECK.—See "Armoured Deck."
  www.royal-navy.org/lib/index.php

* The short, aftermost deck raised above the quarterdeck of a ship. It usually formed the 'coachroof' over the area where the master had his cabin.
  www.parl.ns.ca/woodenships/terms.htm

* on sailing ships, a raised deck at the stern, sometimes forming the roof of a cabin.
  www.cliffsnotes.com/WileyCDA/LitNote/The-Secret-Sharer-Study-and-Homework-Help-Full-Glossary-for-The-Secret-Sharer-.id-8,pageNum-75.html

* A raised after deck, usually over the top of accommodation.
  gjwdirect.co.uk/boatterms

* pooped - The poop is the stern section of a ship. To be pooped is to be swamped by a high, following sea.
  www.georgianindex.net/nautical/terms.html

[/quote][/quote]

Man ive already repped u so i cant :o D:

Read full topic

item.title: Odd sayings
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Definitions of poop on the Web: 
* crap: obscene terms for feces
* nincompoop: a stupid foolish person
* dope: slang terms for inside information; "is that the straight dope?"
* stern: the rear part of a ship
  wordnetweb.princeton.edu/perl/webwn

* Puppis is a constellation in the southern sky. Its name is the Latin word for the poop deck of a ship, and Puppis represents the deck of the ship and its deckhouses. ...
  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poop_(constellation)

* The stern of a ship; To break seawater the poop of a vessel, especially the poop deck; To ship over the stern
  en.wiktionary.org/wiki/poop

* Pooping - Defecation is the final act of digestion by which organisms eliminate solid, semisolid or liquid waste material (feces) from the digestive tract via the anus. ...
  en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pooping

* pooped - Tired; exhausted; To be pooped, in nautical parlance, means to have a wave come over the stern from abaft
  en.wiktionary.org/wiki/pooped

* The raised part of a vessel at her extreme after end. To be pooped is when running before the wind a sea breaks in over the stern.
  www.thecheappages.com/kemp/dictPQ.html

* An extra deck on the after part of a vessel. PORT.—The left-hand side of the ship OS you stand looking forward. PRIZE.—In war time, any vessel taken at sea from an enemy. PROTECTIVE DECK.—See "Armoured Deck."
  www.royal-navy.org/lib/index.php

* The short, aftermost deck raised above the quarterdeck of a ship. It usually formed the 'coachroof' over the area where the master had his cabin.
  www.parl.ns.ca/woodenships/terms.htm

* on sailing ships, a raised deck at the stern, sometimes forming the roof of a cabin.
  www.cliffsnotes.com/WileyCDA/LitNote/The-Secret-Sharer-Study-and-Homework-Help-Full-Glossary-for-The-Secret-Sharer-.id-8,pageNum-75.html

* A raised after deck, usually over the top of accommodation.
  gjwdirect.co.uk/boatterms

* pooped - The poop is the stern section of a ship. To be pooped is to be swamped by a high, following sea.
  www.georgianindex.net/nautical/terms.html</blockquote>
